selected_quotes: Pterosaur or pelican? Convergent evolution strikes again. New species from China
A new species of pterosaur that may have been a flying forager Image credit: Chuang Zhao
#NATURE.COM: An Early Cretaceous pterosaur with unusual mandibular crest from China, potential novel feeding strategy
Pterosaur with a chin crest named for Avatar's flying dragons

citation.abstract: The Aptian Jiufotang Formation of northeast China is a Konservat Lagerstätte particularly rich in pterosaurs, notably azhdarchoids. Here we describe a new genus and species of toothed pteranodontoid pterosaur, Ikrandraco avatar gen. et sp. nov., based on two laterally flattened specimens. Ikrandraco avatar is diagnosed by a suite of features, including a very low and elongate skull, strongly inclined quadrate, and a deep, blade-like bony mandibular crest with a hook-like process on its posterior edge, an unusual structure so far unique to this taxon. The particular skull shape hints at a distinct feeding habit for pterosaurs that potentially includes temporary skimming and an extensible skin acting as a throat pouch that was more developed than in any other pterosaur known so far. The presence of two other taxa of purported piscivorous pterosaurs in the Jiufotang Formation suggests distinct resource exploitation in this part of China during the Early Cretaceous.
citation.title: An Early Cretaceous pterosaur with an unusual mandibular crest from China and a potential novel feeding strategy

wikipedia.title: Ikrandraco
wikipedia.summary: Ikrandraco ("Ikran dragon") is a genus of pteranodontoid pterosaur known from Lower Cretaceous rocks in northeastern China.

wikipedia.title: Ornithocheiromorpha
wikipedia.summary: Ornithocheiromorpha is a group of pterosaurs within the suborder Pterodactyloidea.

news.title: Ancient Flying Reptile Ate Like a Toothy Pelican
news.summary: A pterosaur may have skimmed lakes looking for prey, collecting them in a throat pouch like a pelican's, scientists suggest.

news.title: Ancient 'Toothy Pelican' Looks Like it Came Straight Out of the Movies
news.summary: A newly discovered species of pterosaur has been named after the dragon-like creatures from the visually stunning 2009 movie Avatar, as it happens to sport s similar skull to the four-winged creatures of the sci-fi blockbuster.

news.title: Fossils reveal a dragon-like flying reptile
news.summary: Remains of an ancient flying reptile were discovered in China. And researchers believe it resembles the flying predators, the ikrans, from James Cameron's movie "Avatar."

news.title: Small but real ancient version of ‘ikran’ discovered in China
news.summary: A 120-million-year-old winged reptile (pterosaur) looks just like the animated ikran that flew to victory in the film “Avatar”. The discovery was announced in a Sept. 12, 2014, press release at the Xinhua news service...

news.title: Ikrandraco avatar: Discovery of fossils of flying reptile found in China would make James Cameron proud
news.summary: A pterosaur named Ikrandraco avatar has been discovered in China that resembling the Ikran from Avatar.

news.title: Ikrandraco avatar. Yes, scientists name ancient flying reptile after creatures in 'Avatar' movie
news.summary: Scientists have named a newly discovered ancient flying reptile after creatures from the movie "Avatar." Ikrandraco avatar, which likely lived 120 million years ago, had the same features as the creature from the movie.

news.title: Ancient Flying Beast Named After 'Avatar' Creature
news.summary: If those bizarre flying dragons that carried around blue humanoids in the 2009 science fiction film " Avatar " were real, they likely would have been descendants of this ancient flying reptile: The head reconstruction of Ikrandraco avatar is shown in this

news.title: Ikrandraco: Newly-Discovered Pterosaur Named after Dragons from Avatar Movie
news.summary: An international team of paleontologists has described a new species of flying reptile that lived in what is now China during the Cretaceous period, about 120 millions years ago, and named it after the flying dragon-like creatures from director James Camer

news.title: Fantastic Flying Reptile Straight out of Avatar
news.summary: Wing spans of 39 feet. Pouches like pelicans. A flying reptile that is thought to have been wiped out in a catastrophic meteor impact millions of years ago.Scientists have unearthed two partial skeletons dating back to the Early Cretaceous...

news.title: Ancient 'Dragon' Pterosaur Flew Right Out of 'Avatar'
news.summary: An ancient pterosaur looked so much like the winged predators in the film "Avatar" that its discoverers named the fossilized beast after them.

news.title: Ancient Flying Reptile Resembled Ikran From Avatar Movie

news.title: Ikrandraco avatar fossil discovered in China: This flying reptile had pelican-like throat pouch
news.summary: Flying reptiles would have looked like creatures from the film "Avatar" as they flew over China 120 million years ago, paleontologists say. Movie also inspired scientific name of the new creature: Ikrandraco avatar.

news.title: What do you get when you cross a dragon and a pelican?
news.summary: Ancient flying reptile had throat pouch that may have let it snatch fish from the water

news.title: Flyveøgle opkaldt efter Hollywoodfigur
news.summary: Et nyt flyveøglefund i Kina, har mindet forskerne så meget om Avatar figuren Ikran, at den er blevet opkaldt efter den.

news.title: Pterosaurus Ikrandraco avatar Atas Nama Naga Avatar
news.summary: www.LaporanPenelitian.com - Sekitar 120 juta tahun lalu reptil terbang Cretaceous dengan lebar sayap 2,5 meter dan kantong pelican berburu ikan-ikan kecil danau air tawar di lenskep yang sekarang China. Ikrandraco avatar adalah naga James Cameron. Read mor

news.title: Un dragon fossile semblable aux montures ailées du film Avatar
news.summary: Une nouvelle espèce de ptérosaure ressemble étrangement aux prédateurs ailés chevauchés par les indigènes bleus du film au succès mondial Avatar. Plusieurs caractéristiques anatomiques particulières du fossile découvert ont conduit les paléontologues à le

news.title: Movie Avatar's Dragon Ikran Seemed to Have Flown Out Of The Movie: Similar Dragons Seemed To Have Exist
news.summary: An ancient flying reptile was investigated by scientists who claim that it is similar to the aerial predators known as 'ikran' in the movie 'Avatar'.

blogs.title: Avatar’s Flying Reptiles Soared In Ancient China
blogs.summary: Scientists discover that flying reptiles first seen in a science-fiction film may really have existed hundreds of millions of years ago in China.

author.description: Science, technology, space, medicine, pharma and nature news updates from Asia & Australasia.

blogs.title: Ancient flying reptile was a cross between dragon and pelican
blogs.summary:
Artist impression of the newly discovered Ikrandraco avatar. Image: Scientific Reports

blogs.title: Newly Discovered Pterosaur Named For Flying Avatar Creature - Life finds a way.
blogs.summary:
Movie Avatar, not cartoon Avatar. Ran and Shaw would’ve been too cool.
